name: You have responded (disputed)
body:
Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name)),

You have responded to your ((partner))'s ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)). You have said that you want to dispute the application. 

#What you need to do
You have until ((date of response)) to submit the ‘answer a ((isDivorce??divorce))((isDissolution??dissolution))’ form. 

You can download the form here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/form-d8b-answer-to-a-divorcedissolutionjudicial-separation-or-nullity-petitionapplication

Fill in the form and email it to: ((court email))

Or you can post it to: 

Courts and Tribunals Service centre  
HMCTS ((isDivorce??divorce service))((isDissolution??Ending Civil Partnerships))
PO Box 13226
Harlow
CM20 9UG

You’ll have to pay a £245 fee when you submit the form. If you have little or no savings, are on certain benefits or have low income you may be able to get help paying the fee: https://www.gov.uk/get-help-with-court-fees

#What happens next 
If you submit your answer in time, the ((isDivorce??divorce))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) will become 'disputed'. You may have to go to a hearing with your ((partner)) to reach an agreement. 

If you do not submit your answer before ((date of response)) then your ((partner)) can continue the ((isDivorce??divorce))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)). 

You can track the progress of the ((isDivorce??divorce))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) here: ((signin url))

Your feedback helps us improve this service for others: https://smartsurvey.co.uk/s/SurveyExit/?service=Divorce&party=resp&def=y

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)
subject: You have responded to the application ((isDivorce??for divorce))((isDissolution??to end your civil partnership))
